intro: Hymenoxys cabrerae, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright orange to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Hymenoxys cabrerae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
